data.title: Weekend Calendar (March 16-18)
data.meta_description:
ROCK 
 
 1810 Tavern , Bridgewater, 9 p.m. March 17, Sidewinder Band (unplugged), no cover.
 
 Luanne's Route 68, Industry, 9:30 p.m. March 16 and March 17, Leftover Blues and Go-Saga, (classic), no â€¦
data.text:
ROCK

1810 Tavern, Bridgewater, 9 p.m. March 17, Sidewinder Band (unplugged), no cover.

Luanne's Route 68, Industry, 9:30 p.m. March 16 and March 17, Leftover Blues and Go-Saga, (classic), no cover.

Marion Hill Grill, New Brighton, 10 p.m. March 17, John Galt Theory, St. Patrick's Day Party, no cover.

Uncl' Chuck's, Rochester, 9:30 p.m. March 17, Lobotomy, no cover.

BLUES

Kendrew's Lounge, Aliquippa, 9 p.m. March 16, Billy the Kid, $2.

Venue at Harmony Ridge, Harmony Township, 9 p.m. March 16, jazz, soul and blues jam session with (989), no cover; 8:30 p.m. March 17, St. Patrick's Day blues jam session, Misery Loves Company, Blue & Evil, 32/20, no cover.

JAZZ

Clark's, Moon Township, 8 p.m. March 17, Johnny Vann Trio, no cover.

COUNTRY

Kendrew's Lounge, Aliquippa, 9 p.m. March 17, Hillburys, $5.

ACOUSTIC

Ambridge VFW, Ambridge, 8 pm. March 16, Frank Piscopo & the Best of Times, no cover.

IRISH MUSIC

Kelly's Riverside Saloon, Bridgewater, 10 p.m. March 16, Shanid, (traditional), no cover.

Shakespeare's Restaurant, North Sewickley Township, 7 p.m. March 17, Brigadoon Highlanders, (pipes and drums), St. Patrick's Day Celebration, no cover.

DISC JOCKEYS

Baden American Legion, Baden, 8 p.m. March 16, Bobby Edmond, (oldies and shag), no cover.

Hollywood Gardens, Rochester, 9 p.m. March 17, Frank E. Fresh, no cover.

Jimmy K's, New Brighton, 10 p.m. March 16, Zipo Zero, no cover; 10 p.m. March 17, Mikey P., no cover.

Longbranch Saloon, New Brighton, 9:30 p.m. March 16, CB, no cover; 9:30 p.m. March 17, CB, St. Patrick's Day Party, no cover.

Marion Hill Grill, New Brighton, 9 p.m. March 16, Book, no cover.

19th Hole, Chippewa Township, 9:30 p.m. March 16, Andy, no cover; 9:30 p.m. March 17, Boz, no cover.

Sims Lanes, Big Beaver, 9:30 p.m. March 17, Diehlz, no cover.

Wooley Bully's, New Brighton, 5 p.m. March 17, Cugs, Francie T, Big Wood, St. Patrick's Day Party, no cover.

KARAOKE

Baden American Legion, Baden, 8 p.m. March 17, Budman, no cover.

Rook's, Ambridge, 9 p.m. March 17, no cover.

DANCES

Ballroom, 7 to 10 p.m. March 17, New Brighton SOI. Music by Mikey Dee. $8. Singles welcome.

Square, 8:30 to 11:30 p.m. March 24, Big Knob Grange, New Sewickley Township. $5. (724) 775-3016.

Ballroom, Latin and swing, 8 to 11 p.m. March 18, Coraopolis VFW, Fifth Avenue and Mulberry Streets. Music by Frankie Lasko. $8.

Line, 9:30 a.m. March 20 New Brighton SOI. $2.

Country, 8 to midnight March 17 at the Aliquippa Croatian Center, 2365 Concord St., Aliquippa. Music by Eldorado country band. $6.

Singles, 8 p.m. to midnight March 17, West View VFW Post 2754, 386 Perry Highway. $8. St. Pat's Day Party. (724) 316-5029 or www.dancetonight.weebly.com.

COMEDY

The Improv at the Waterfront at Homestead, Frank Caliendo, 8 and 10 p.m. March 16, 7 and 9 p.m. March 17 and 7 p.m. March 18. $35.

Dave O'Roark & Dwayne Smith, Christian comedians from Columbus, Ohio, 7 p.m. March 18, Community Life Center at Chippewa United Methodist Church, Chippewa Township. O'Roark is a Blackhawk graduate. $10. Part of the church's Coffee House Cabaret. Includes dessert, for which a love offering will be taken.

Bill Maher, 8 p.m. April 14, Byham Theater, Pittsburgh. $64.50 to $89.50.

Jim Krenn, May 26, Byham Theater, Pittsburgh. $32.50 to $52.50.

COMMUNITY, CLASSICAL CONCERTS

St. Luke's Steel Drum Band from New Haven, Conn., 5:15 p.m. March 16, Penn State Beaver Student Union Building. Band members are from Barbados, Grenada, Jamaica, Montserrat, Nevis, and Trinidad and Tobago. Free.

St. Patrick's Day Pops presented by the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra with violinist Natalie MacMaster; 8 p.m. March 16 and 17 and 2:30 p.m. March 18 at Heinz Hall, Pittsburgh and 8 p.m. March 19 at the Scottish Rite Cathedral in New Castle. Heinz Hall shows are $20 to $95 at (412) 392-4900 or www.pittsburghsymphony.org. New Castle show is $16 to $59 at (800) 743-8560 or www.pittsburghsymphony.org/src. Special parent-child package available by calling (412) 392-4819.

Broadway's Leslie Alexander performs the music of Jerry Herman, 8 p.m. March 16 and 17, at The Strand Theater, 119 N. Main St., Zelienople. Alexander starred in original cast of "Mama Mia" and performed opposite Hugh Jackman in "The Boy From Oz." Reserved seating $25 and $35. (724) 742-0400 or www.thestrandtheater.org.

Organist Ken Cowan in concert, 4 p.m. March 19 at St. Paul Cathedral, Fifth Avenue and Craig St., Oakland. Presented by the Organ Artists Series of Pittsburgh. Tickets: adults, $12; students, $5. (412)242-2787 or www.oas-series.com.

Third From First, Christian rock band, 7:30 p.m. March 24, Strand Theater, Zelienople. $10 festival seating. Proceeds go to St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital.

Renaissance & Baroque presents the Blue Heron at 8 p.m. March 24 at Calvary Episcoapl Church, 315 Shady Ave., Shadyside. $10 to $35. (412-361-2048 or www.rbsp.org.

Violinist Sarah Chang performs "West Side Story" songs with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra at 8 p.m. March 23 and 2:30 p.m. March 25 at Heinz Hall, Pittsburgh. Yan Pascal Tortelier conducts. $20 to $93. (412) 392-4900 or www.pittsburghsymphony.org.

The Freya String Quartet, 3 p.m. March 25 at St. James Catholic Church, 200 Walnut St., Sewickley. Music from Vivaldi to Cole Porter to Radiohead. Free. Meet-and-greet follows concert. Sewickley Academy musicians perform at 2:30 p.m. (412) 741-6650.

Jack Kurutz piano recital 3 p.m. March 25 at Hebron Presbyterian Church, Route 30, Findlay Township. Free; free will offering will be taken to support West Allegheny Food Bank. (724) 899-2276 or www.symbioticcollusion.com.

Mendelssohn Choir of Pittsburgh presents its spring concert "Great Mass in C Minor" at 3 p.m. March 25 at East Liberty Presbyterian Church, Highland and Penn avenues, Pittsburgh. Tickets: in advance, adults, $25; students, $10; youth younger than 18, $5; at door, adults, $30; students, $15. (888)718-4253 or www.themendelssohn.org.

Steel Drum Festival featuring Liam Teague, 7:30 p.m. March 26 at Lincoln Park Performing Arts Center, Midland. $10. (724) 643-9004 or www.lppac.org.

Nearly Neil & the Solitary Band features Bobby Bruce as Neil Diamond, 7:30 p.m. March 29 at the Beaver Falls Middle School auditorium, 1601 Eighth Ave,. Beaver Falls. Tickets: adults, $20; students $5. (724) 843-2941. Sponsored by the Beaver Valley Community Concert Association.

Pittsburgh Camerata chamber choir presents "Legends and Visionaries," at 8 p.m. March 30 at Sixth Presbyterian Church, 1688 Murray Ave., Squirrel Hill; at 8 p.m. March 31 at St. Andrew's Episcopal Church, 5801 Hampton St., Pittsburgh; and at 4 p.m. April 1 at Mount Lebanon United Methodist Church, 3319 West Liberty Ave. Tickets: in advance, $15; at door, $20; students, $5. (412) 421-5884 or www.pittsburghcamerata.org.

Gathering Gospel Concert featuring New Jerusalem Bluegrass and Heavens Rush Quartet, 7 p.m. March 31 at Lillyville Church of God, 408 Hickernell Road, Franklin Township. Free; free-will offering at door. Doors open at 6 p.m. (724) 480-5187.

"Best Loved Musicals" featuring the River City Brass Band, 7:30 p.m. April 4 at the Lincoln Park Performing Arts Center in Midland. $19 and $21; $2 discount for seniors. (800) 292-7222 or rivercitybrass.org.

Pure Gold presented by Divine Mercy Academy, 7:30 p.m. April 14, at the Lincoln Park Performing Arts Center, Midland. $25. (724) 643-9004. or www.lppac.org.

Bass Palo Pecchioli in concert, 6 p.m. April 16 at the George. R. White Studio, Pittsburgh Opera Headquarters, 2425 Liberty Ave., Pittsburgh. $50. (412) 281-0912, Ext. 222 or www.pittsburghopera.org.

NATIONALLY TOURING CONCERT ACTS

Lee Ritenour, 7 and 9:30 p.m. March 16 at the Manchester Craftsmen's Guild, Pittsburgh's North Side. Sold out.

The Fresh Beat Band, 3 p.m. March 17, Byham Theater. Sold out.

Celtic Woman "Believe", 7:30 p.m. March 21, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. $41.70 to $83.60.

Van Halen, 7:30 p.m. March 30, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. $28 to $142.50.

Preservation Hall Jazz Band, 8 p.m. March 24 and 2:30 p.m. March 25, Manchester Craftsmen's Guild, Pittsburgh. $52.50 and $57.50.

The Moody Blues, 8 p.m. April 2, Benedum Center, Pittsburgh. $60.25 and $75.25.

Daughtry, 7:30 p.m. April 4, Benedum Center, Pittsburgh. $32.50 to $52.50.

Mastodon, 7:30 p.m. April 15, Stage AE. $29.50 and $34.

Psychedelic Furs, 8 p.m. April 6, Carnegie Lecture Hall, Pittsburgh. $22.

Young the Giant, 8 p.m. April 20, Stage AE, Pittsburgh. $15 and $18.

All-American Rejects, 7 p.m. April 25, Stage AE, Pittsburgh. $25.

Nickelback and Bush, 6:30 p.m. April 25, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. $49.50 to $89.50.

Squeeze and the English Beat, April 26, Carnegie Library Music Hall, Munhall. $37 to $65.

Leon Russell, 8:30 p.m. April 27, Altar Bar, Pittsburgh. $32.50 and $35.

Christina Perri, 7:30 p.m. May 2, Carnegie Library Music Hall, Munhall. $20 and $22.

Marilyn Manson, 7:30 p.m. May 5, Stage AE outdoors, Pittsburgh. $38 and $40.

Rise Against, 7:30 p.m. May 6, Stage AE outdoors. $36 and $39.

Vince Gill, 8 p.m. May 6, Palace Theatre, Greensburg. $45 to $90.

Flogging Molly, 8 p.m. May 10, Stage AE, Pittsburgh. $28.50 and $30.

Beach Boys 50th anniversary tour, 8 p.m. May 11, Benedum Center, Pittsburgh. $80.25 to $153.25.

Rob Zombie and Megadeth, 7 p.m. May 16, Stage AE, Pittsburgh. $39.50.

Gordon Lightfoot, 8 p.m. May 16, Palace Theatre, Greensburg. $42 to $55.

Glen Campbell, 7:30 p.m. May 20, Byham Theater, Pittsburgh. $52.50 to $62.50.

Avett Brothers, 8 p.m. May 20, Stage AE outdoors, Pittsburgh. $38 and $40.

Primus, 7:30 p.m. May 22, Stage AE outdoors, Pittsburgh. $36 and $38.

Red Hot Chili Peppers, 7:30 p.m. May 30, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. $41.50 to $62.50.

Lady Antebellum with Darius Rucker, June 2, First Niagara Pavilion, Burgettstown. $25 to $54.50. On sale March 16.

Girl Talk, 8 p.m. June 9, Stage AE outdoors, Pittsburgh. $25.

fun., 8 p.m. June 15, Stage AE, Pittsburgh. $20.

Buddy Guy and Jonny Lang, 8 p.m. June 15, Palace Theatre, Greensburg. $49.50 and $59.50.

Childish Gambino, 7 p.m. June 18, Stage AE, Pittsburgh. $23.

James Taylor, 8 p.m. June 20, Petersen Events Center, Pittsburgh. $59.50 and $79.50.

Phish, 7:30 p.m. June 23, First Niagara Pavilion, Burgettstown. $57.50 and $74. On sale 1 p.m. March 16.

Kenny Chesney and Tim McGraw, 4:30 p.m. June 30, Heinz Field, Pittsburgh. $46.15 to $272.35.

Roger Waters, 7 p.m. July 3, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. $57.75 to $209.

David Allan Coe, 7:30 p.m. July 7, Pepsi Cola Roadhouse, Burgettstown. $42.10 to $62.55.

Dave Matthews Band, 7 p.m. July 13 and 14, First Niagara Pavilion, Burgettstown. Lawn: $40.50; reserved $59.50 and $75.

Wynonna & the Big Noise, July 18, Palace Theatre, Greensburg. $45 to $65 ($125 for pit seat and meet-and-greet.)

Heart, 8 p.m. July 26, Stage AE outdoors, Pittsburgh. $39.50 and $42.

Toby Keith, July 27, First Niagara Pavilion, Burgettstown. Prices to be announced.

Rod Stewart and Stevie Nicks, 7:30 p.m. July 28, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. $49.50 to $149.50.

Big Time Rush, 7 p.m., Aug. 5, First Niagara Pavilion, Burgettstown. $20 to $69.50.

Jason Aldean, Aug. 17, First Niagara Pavilion, Burgettstown. To be announced.

Rascal Flatts, Sept. 1, First Niagara Pavilion. To be announced.

Madonna, Nov. 6, Consol Energy Center, Pittsburgh. Sold out.

Vince Gill and Kix Brooks, 7:30 p.m. Nov. 10, Pepsi Cola Roadhouse, Burgettstown. $107.60 to $134.20.

THEATER & DANCE SHOWS

"Pinocchio," 7:30 p.m. March 16 and 17 at the Comtra Theatre, Route 19, Cranberry Township. $12. (724) 773-9896. No reserved seating.

PNC Broadway Across America's "La Cage Aux Folles," Tony Award winning best revival, starring George Hamilton, 8 p.m. March 16; 2 and 8 p.m. March 17 and 1 and 6:30 p.m. March 18 at the Benedum Center, Pittsburgh. $20 to $71. (412) 456-6666 or www.TrustArts.org.

Spirit of Uganda, Eastern African music and dance, 4 p.m. March 18, Byham Theater, Pittsburgh. $18 to $35. (412) 456-6666 or www.TrustArts.org.

"Tosca" presented by the Pittsburgh Opera at 8 p.m. March 24, 7 p.m. March 27, 8 p.m. March 30 and 2 p.m. April 1 at the Benedum Center, Pittsburgh. $10.75 to $195.75. (412) 281-0912 or www.pittsburghopera.org.

"Freud's Last Session" presented by Pittsburgh Public Theater through April 1 at the O'Reilly Theater, Pittsburgh. Performances 8 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays, except March 27 at 7 p.m., and 2 p.m. Saturdays and most Sundays at 2 and 7 p.m. Tickets: adults, $22 to $55; students, age 26 and younger with ID, $15.75. (412) 316-1600 or www.ppt.org.

Bruce J. Robinson's "MIA: Missing in Action" world premiere presented by the REP, Point Park University's professional theatre company, March 23 through April 7 at the Pittsburgh Playhouse in Oakland. Performances are 8 p.m. Thursdays through Saturdays; 2 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays, and 8 p.m. April 4. Tickets: $24 to $27, pay what you will performance at 2 p.m. March 24. Preview at 8 p.m. March 22. (412) 392-8000 or www.pittsburghplayhouse.com.

"The House that Carol Built" presented by Kuntu Repertory Theatre through March 31 at Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh, Homewood branch, 7101 Hamilton Ave. Tickets: adults, evening performances, $20; matinees, $15; students, $5; seniors, $11. (412) 394-3353 or www.ProArtsTickets.org.

"The Little Mermaid" presented by the Carnegie Performing Arts Center, 8 p.m. March 23 and 24, and 2 and 8 p.m. March 25 at the Andrew Carnegie Music Hall, 300 Beechwood Ave., Carnegie. Tickets: adults, $12; students and seniors, $10. (412) 279-8887 or www.carnegieperformingartscenter.com.

"Late Nite Catechism 2: Sister Strikes Again!" 1:30 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. March 24 at St. Ferdinand Church, 2535 Rochester Road, Cranberry Township. $32.40 to $47.50.

"The Phantom Tollbooth Jr." children's program presented by Jeter Backyard Theater, 11 a.m. and 1 and 3 p.m. March 24 at Lincoln Park Performing Arts Center, Midland. $8. (724) 643-9004, option 2 or www.lppac.org.

"MythBusters: Behind the Myths" 7:30 p.m. March 27, Heinz Hall, Pittsburgh, starring Jamie Hyneman and Adam Savage, co-hosts of the Emmy-nominated Discovery Channel series, "MythBusters." $35 to $85. (412) 392-4900, or pittsburghsymphony.org.

Disney's "Beauty and the Beast", April 3 to 8 at Heinz Hall, Pittsburgh. Performances at 7:30 p.m. April 3 and 4; 1 and 7:30 p.m. April 5; 8 p.m. April 6; 2 and 8 p.m. APril 7 and 1 p.m. April 8. $20 to $77. (412) 392-4900 or www.TrustArts.org.

HIGH SCHOOL MUSICALS

"42nd Street" presented by West Allegheny High School students, 7 p.m. March 16 and 17 in the high school auditorium. Tickets: adults, $10; senior citizens , gold card members and students, $5. (724) 695-5269 or tsnyder@westasd.org.

"Seussical" presented by Beaver County Christian School, 7:30 p.m. March 16 and 17, in the high school auditorium. Tickets: adults, $10; students, high school and younger, $8. (724) 843-3002.

"Guys and Dolls" presented by Moon Area High School, 7 p.m. March 16 and 17 and 2 p.m. March 18 in the high school auditorium. Tickets: adults, $12; students and seniors, $10. (412) 264-9440.

LECTURES

Henry Rollins, spoken-word performance by the founder of seminal punk-rock band Black Flag, 8 p.m. March 17, Carnegie Lecture Hall, Pittsburgh. $25. warhol.org.

EXHIBITS

Old Economy Village, 270 16th St., Ambridge reopens from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 17. To celebrate opening day, bring a non-perishable food item for the Center of Hope Food Bank in Ambridge in lieu of admission. Guided tours will be from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays, and noon to 5 p.m. Sundays. The village will remain open year around. Closed Mondays. Admission: adults, $10; senior citizens, $9; youth, ages 3 to 11, $5; children younger than 2, free. (412) 266-4500 or www.oldeconomyvillage.org.

"M is for Museum" through Aug. 26 at the Carnegie Museum of Natural History, Oakland. Adults, $15; seniors, $12; children, ages 3 to 18 and students, $11. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays; 10 am. to 8 p.m. Thursdays; noon to 5 p.m. Sundays. Free admission on Thursday nights in March. (412) 622-3131 or www.carnegiemnh.org.

Masters of the Sky: Raptors!, 11 a.m. to 3 pm. March 17 and 18 at the National Aviary, Pittsburgh's North Side. Regular hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily. General admission: adults, $13; seniors, $12; children, ages 2 to 12, $11. (412) 323-7235.

"Civil War in Pennsylvania" display commemorating the 150th anniversary of the Civil War, March 31 through Labor Day at the Beaver Area Heritage Museum, 1 River Road, Beaver. The Heinz History Center's traveling exhibit -- four life-size historic figures and modular panels describing Pennsylvania's war contributions will be displayed through April 22. From April 28 on, the museum will display its own Civil War collections. Hours: 10 a.m. to 4 pm. Saturdays, and 1 to 4 p.m. Sundays. Group tours by appointment. Free. (724) 775-7174 or www.beaverheritage.org.

Carnegie Museum of Art presents "Picturing the City: Downtown Pittsburgh, 2007-10," featuring 86 recent images from nine photographers who call Pittsburgh home, through March 25. Also on display through April 7: "Teenie Harris, Photographer: An American Story" featuring 987 of Pittsburgh Courier photographer Charles "Teenie" Harris's historically significant images. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays; 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Thursdays; noon to 5 p.m. Sundays. Admission: (includes Carnegie Museum of Natural History): adults, $15; seniors, 65 and older, $12; students and children ages 3 to 18, $11; children age 2 and younger and members, free. Free admission on Thursday nights in March. (412) 622-3131 or www.cmoa.org.

Will Eisner's New York, a collection of original works that chronicles the artist's informal history of New York, through May 27,ToonSeum, 945 Liberty Ave., Pittsburgh. Adults and children 13 and older, $5; children, ages 6 to 12, $1; children, ages 5 and younger, free. (412) 232-0199 or www.toonseum.org.

Transformation 8: Contemporary Works in Small Metals exhibit through June 30 at the Society for Contemporary Craft, 2100 Smallman St., Pittsburgh's Strip District. (412) 261-7003 or www.contemporarycraft.org.

Spring Flower Show, a celebration of locales and cultures, March 17 to April 15 at at Phipps Conservatory and Botanical Gardens, Schenley Park, Oakland. Tropical Forest India now open. Premiere party at 7 p.m. March 17. Daily from 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Adults, $12; seniors and students, $11; children, age 2 to 18, $9, children, younger than 2, free. (412) 622-6914 or phipps.conservatory.org.

Student Portfolio Show, a collection of graphic design and multimedia works by Pittsburgh Technical Institute students through March 28 at the PTI Showcase located inside Entry 3 lower level in The Mall at Robinson in Robinson Township.

The 16th "Gestures Intimate Friction" exhibition featuring artists, architects and activists opens with an artists' reception from 6 to 8 p.m. March 30 at the Mattress Factory, Annex Gallery, 1414 Monterey St., Pittsburgh's North Side. Admission: $12. Continues through Nov. 30. Also, "Factory Installed," a site-specific exhibition by artists in residence through May 1 in the main galleries at 500 Sampsonia Way, Pittsburgh's North Side. Admission: $12; seniors, $10; students, $9; children younger than 6, free.www. mattress.org.

SpaceOut Astronomy weekend, a star studded astronomy party in the Buhl Digistal Planetarium, March 24 and 25 at the Carnegie Science Center, Pittsburgn's North Side. Exhibits include Air Power!, Body Tech, roboworld, and Highmark SportsWorks. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sundays through Fridays; 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturdays. General admission: adults, $17.95; chldren ages 3 to 12, $11.95. (412) 237-3400 or www.CarnegieScienceCenter.org.

"Wheels," an exhibit about fun with kinds of wheels, riding, balancing, climbing, building through May 18 at the Children's Museum of Pittsburgh on the city's North Side. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays, and noon to 5 p.m. Sundays. Admission: adults, $12; children ages 2 to 18 and senior citizens, $11; children younger than 2, free. (412) 322-5058 or pittsburghkids.org.

Student & Instructor Exhibition through March 30 at Sweetwater Center for the Arts, 200 Broad St., Sewickley. Free.

"The Merrick Art Gallery Presents: The American Civil War" exhibit through March 18 at the New Brighton gallery. Features pieces from eight Beaver County high school artists. Gallery hours: 10 am. to 4:30 p.m. Tuesdays through Saturdays and 1 to 4 p.m. Sundays. Free. (724) 846-1130 or email to merrickartgallery@verizon.net.

"Warhol and Cars: American Icons," the Andy Warhol Museum, Pittsburgh's North Side through May 13. More than 40 pieces are featured in the first exhibition to examine Warhol's fascination with automobiles as products of American consumer society. Also: Warhol's "Dogs and Cats" paintings from 1976, through June 30; "About Face," portrait series created by New York photographer Arne Svenson Large-format, 3-D portraits of students in Pittsburgh's Wesley Spectrum Highland, a private school for students with special needs through May 13. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays; 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Fridays. Admission: $20 for adults; $10 for children and students. Free admission on Thursday nights in March. (412) 237-8300 or warhol.org.

"Stars & Stripes: An American Story," exhibit, Sen. John Heinz History Center, Smallman Street, Pittsburgh's Strip District. Flag folding events at 12:30 p.m. April 14, May 19, June 17, (retirement ceremony). Other events. "America's Best Weekly: A Century of the Pittsburgh Courier," through June 2. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily. Admission: adults, $10; seniors age 62 and older, $9; students and children age 4 to 17, $5; children younger than 3, free. heinzhistorycenter.org.

SPECIAL SCREENINGS

"Born to be Wild," IMAX film at the Carnegie Science Center, Pittsburgh's North Side. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sundays through Fridays, and 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturdays. General admissions: adults, $17.95; children, ages 3 to 12, $11.95. (412) 237-3400 or carnegiesciencecenter.org.

Movies & Martinis, fifth annual international short film showcase sponsored by Women in Film & Media, 7 p.m. March 24, 11 Stanwix St., downtown Pittsburgh. Showcases nine short films by women from around the world. Reception at 6 p.m. includes a vodka tasting, appetizers and networking. $15 advance; $20 at the door. wifmpit.org.

"We are All Immigrants" featuring generations of immigrants who share the pains and joys of settling in western Pennsylvania, 2 p.m. March 25, the Sen. John Heinz History Center, Pittsburgh. The 30-minute documentary was conceived by Dennis Woytek, assistant professor in journalism at Duquesne University, with narration by local broadcaster Lynn Cullen. Light refreshments will be served. Free admission, but advance registration required by March 16 at rgallentine@osfprov.org or to Sister Jeanette at (724) 869-2151, ext. 6247.

Banff Mountain Film Festival, award-winning films about outdoor life, 7 p.m. April 6 and 7, Byham Theater, Pittsburgh. Films include "On the Trail of Genghis Khan: The Last Frontier," and the British Columbia-set "Spoil." $9 to $20. ventureoutdoors.org.

AUDITIONS AND CALL TO ARTISTS

Local artists sought for "Confluence: The Merrick Masters Art Exhibition" at the Merrick Art Gallery, New Brighton. Deadline is April 3. Artists must live within 75 miles of New Brighton. Exhibit is May 18 to July 6. $3,000 in prizes. Exhibition specifics and entry form are at merrickartgallery.org.

For "The Odd Couple" presented by R-Act Theater Productions, 7 to 8 p.m. March 16 at the R-Act office, 1445 Market St., Bridgewater.

Rocket to the Stars singing contest, 1 to 5 p.m. March 17, McConomy Auditorium, Carnegie Mellon University. Registration from noon to 2 p.m. Finalists will compete July 14 at the 21st annual Fireworks Festival in New Castle for prizes including $10,000.

WINE AND FOOD TASTINGS

"Who Moved My Cheese?" fondue night featuring Carol Pascuzzi from the Pennsylvania Macaroni Company in Pittsburgh's Strip District, 6 p.m. March 16 at the Hyeholde Restaurant, Coraopolis Heights Road, Moon Township. Several different fondues served and a tasting of white wines. $28. Reservations required at (412) 264-3116 or www.hyeholde.com.

Casual Pairing: A Toast to Your Health, Heritage Valley's biennial wine and culinary event, 7 to 10 p.m. April 14 at the Hyatt Regency Pittsburgh International Airport. Features food from 20 chefs and a variety of wines and spirits from regional and national wineries. $125 per person. (412) 749-7050 or www.heritagevalley.org/wine. Benefits the cardiology funds at Heritage Valley Beaver and Heritage Valley Sewickley Foundations.

ETC

Distinctively Dutch Festival, a celebration of the culture and arts of the Netherlands featuring an array of United States and world premieres at various venues throughout Pittsburgh, through May 20. Dance, theater, music, visual art, film, literature and architecture. Sponsored by the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust. Schedule available at TrustArts.org/dutchfestival.

Star Party sponsored by the Beaver Valley Space Sciences Interest Group, at sunset March 17 at the baseball fields in Bradys Run Park, Brighton Township, weather permitting. Cloud date, March 24. (724) 846-2573 or (412) 908-0653.

Picture Car Cruise, 3 to 6 p.m. March 18, the Willows Inn, Industry. Bring a photo of your cruiser. Free admission and door prizes.

BACHday Bash presented by the Bach Choir of Pittsburgh, 7 p.m. March 24 at the Smart House on Mount Washington, Pittsburgh. Dinner, entertainment, dancing, silent auction. Tickets: $75. VIP preview at 6 p.m., wine and cheese tasting, $125 each, two for $200.

Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Hall & Museum Hall of Valor induction, 2 p.m. March 25 at the hall, 4141 Fifth Ave., Oakland. Free. Reservations available for $40 for celebratory dinner that follows in ballroom. (412) 621-4253 or http://ww.soldiersandsailorshall.org/veteran-hall-of-valor.html.

Pittsburgh Shakespeare in the Parks' Bring Your Own Bard presents "Shakespeare on the Irish (and the Scots, and the French...)" 7:30 p.m. March 26, Te Cafe, 2000 Murray Ave., Squirrel Hill. Audience members encouraged to read scenes or monologues from Shakespeare plays. Donations welcome. People interested in reading should contact BYOB@pittsburghshakespeare.com

Rob Pratte roast, honoring the KDKA-AM talk-show host, 6 p.m. March 31, the Club at Shadow Lakes, Hopewell Township. Tickets: $150 includes dinner and musical entertainment by classical guitarist Irvin Kauffman and cellist Adam Liu of the Pittsburgh Symphony, singer Vanessa Campagna and the Renaissance Rhythm Chorus/Sweet Adelines. Benefits the Roxsan Betters Albanese Foundation helping children who are terminally ill or face a life-threatening situation.

Western Pennsylvania Kennel Association's dog shows, 9 a.m. March 31 and April 1, Monroeville Convention Center. $9 for adults; $3 for children ages 4 to 9; free for children 3 and younger.
